alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 5:56PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Wharton, southeastern Fort Bend, northwestern Brazoria and north central Matagorda Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 555 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Needville to near Brazos Bend State Park to near Alvin. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Angleton, southern Manvel, West Columbia, Needville, Iowa Colony, Holiday Lakes, Pleak, Fairchilds, Bailey`s Prairie, Bonney, Brazos Bend State Park, Boling-Iago, northern Wild Peach Village, southeastern Sienna Plantation, Juliff, Damon and Rosharon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
